author: Stockx Scam
text:

STOCKX CLAIM THEY WANT TO TAKE THEIR COMPANY PUBLIC. BUT I AM NOT SURE HOW THEY EXPECT THAT TO BE SUCCESSFUL WHEN THEIR COMPANY IS BUILT ON STEALING FROM THEIR CUSTOMERS. GOD DOES NOT LIKE UGLY. MOST OF THEIR POSITIVE REVIEWS ARE FAKE! 

If you are a disgruntled customer who has been scammed by stock x in any of these ways please contact stockxscam @ gmail.com. They need to be held to account before more people are scammed and they further ruin the sneaker market.

1) Purchaed fake shoes which they are unwilling to refund.

2) Sold an item and they claim it has gone missing. They have offered no resolution. 

3) If you have noticed unusual price fluctuations on their platform. 

4) Customer service has not helped in anyway. 

5) They have refused a refund even with the item not being as described. 

6) Bought a pair of shoes and they began to fall apart.

Stock x chargers the seller and buyer fees on the same product. They expect sellers to sell their items at a lower price meaning you make no profit whilst they sell the same item for significant amount more to the buyer than the seller of the item. Money hungry thieving clowns you will be held to account sooner or later!

text:

3 months later I’m £550 down with no refund even though I’m entitled to one!  stock x refuse to process it for me. 

Scamming company never use them!!

Now ignoring my emails

author: AR
text:
First purchase on StockX, and it will be my last.

I was delivered shoes that had a deformed section on the sole. They played it off as a “manufacturing defect”, saying it was considered acceptable by their standards as it would be deemed acceptable in a retail store. 

Now, I would love to see whoever created the horrendous policies at StockX to attempt to say to trading standards, with all seriousness, that they would expect a high-street store to sell defect goods on their shelves. 

Utterly ridiculous. Avoid, avoid, avoid. Zero integrity in their practice.

Update: Completely unsurprised to see an equally unhelpful and useless response from the company. I can make an assurance myself; StockX and its lack of integrity is an insult to the service sector.
title: Do yourself the favour.

text:

author: german avetisov
text: I put my Jordan Dior shoes up for sale, which I won in a raffle. The raffle was won by my father who passed away a year ago. When shipping the shoes, I packaged them very delicately and neat, with the original receipt of purchase. The next morning I received a notification saying my shoes are getting shipped back to me due to them not passing the authentication. I am not sure who is validating these shoes, but whoever is needs appropriate training because they clearly don't know what they are doing. they hit me with a fine of $15 which is mind-blowing. Today I received the shoes, I open the box and my shoes are all over the place and not as I packaged them. The main issue is that they did not include my original receipt in the box. I don't know if they swapped my shoes either. Reached out to customer support over live-chat and the guy goes " Im sorry to hear that. You can go to the Dior store and reprint the receipt". Yea thanks let me bring my father back from the dead and go reprint the receipt. This has been the worst experience ever and I would not recommend using StockX to anyone.
